channel.title: Finance
channel.description: Latest investing news and finance headlines straight from Wall Street.
Liberty Media Chairman John Malone said the sizzling IPO market and soaring equity valuations remind him of the dotcom bubble in the late 1990s.
These are the stocks posting the largest moves before the bell.
"It's a mixed bag. There's a lot of fluff out there," J. Christopher Flowers told CNBC.
Some 43% of adults with combined finances in a relationship said they've committed an act of financial deception, according to a survey.
N26's American customers will no longer be able to use its app from Jan. 11, 2022.
Highly indebted developer China Evergrande will likely default because the company has essentially lost its main business, S&P Global Ratings analysts said.
Fraudulent activity is on the rise at some of the largest buy now, pay later (BNPL) platforms, according to experts.
China Evergrande is set to raise about $273 million by selling its remaining shares in film production and streaming company HengTen Networks, a filing said.
The Economic Cycle Research Institute’s Lakshman Achuthan warns consumer spending is in a cyclical slowdown, and it will weigh on holiday sales.
U.S. stocks slipped on Thursday despite strong quarterly results from Nvidia, Macy's and Kohl's.
See which stocks are posting big moves after the bell on Wednesday, November 17.
Saule Omarova, President Joe Biden's choice to lead one of the nation's top bank regulators, is set for a fiery nomination hearing.
Many older Americans retired during the Covid pandemic. Whether they will return has been an open question.
These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.
Dipanjan 'DJ' Deb, the Co-Founder and CEO of Francisco Partners, revealed what keeps him up at night, despite the firm's outperformance.
Rivian's blockbuster IPO last week pushed the total exit value from U.S. public-market listings this year beyond an unprecedented $1 trillion marker.
The Biden Administration is asking the Federal Trade Commission to investigate "mounting evidence of anti-consumer behavior" by energy companies as gas prices hover at multi-year highs.
These are the stocks posting the largest moves before the bell.
Amazon has told some customers that, from Jan. 19 2022 onward, the company will no longer accept Visa credit cards issued in Britain.
American hedge fund manager Ray Dalio is launching a new China fund through a local subsidiary, according to China's Securities Times, citing sources.
Stocks fell on Wednesday following earnings reports from big-box retailers.
The tax break for parents is poised to revert to its level before the 2017 Tax Cuts and Jobs Act unless Congress intervenes.
These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.
Shares of Blue Prism surged Tuesday after the British software company received a higher takeover offer from U.S.-based tech firm SS&C Technologies Holdings.
The Build Back Better Act would let same-sex married couples in some states file a joint tax return for years before 2010, which might yield a net tax benefit.
Upgrade is the latest company to benefit from the "buy now, pay later" trend in fintech.
The stocks making the biggest moves in premarket trading include Rackspace Technology, Axon Enterprise, Royalty Pharma, and more.
The sharp rebound in business activity this year has translated to unprecedented workloads for Wall Street professionals — and a competitive job market.
Allianz's Mohamed El-Erian says he purchased an unspecified amount of bitcoin when it plunged close to $3,000 in the "crypto winter" of 2018.
The leaders ended the meeting shortly before 12:30 p.m. Beijing time (11:30 p.m. ET Monday), almost four hours after it began, according to Chinese state media.
